content: FHIRcast connectathon track will be Wednesday, May 13th through Friday, May 15th. See the details, here: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2020-05+Connectathon+24

Hey Guys, Does this FHIRcast connectathon track status check-in schedule work for you?

Official hours of FHIRcast Connectathon track (zoom will be open during this time): * Thursday, May 14, 2020: 9am ET – 6pm EST * Friday, May 15, 2020: 9am ET – 6pm ET with wrap-up from 6-630pm ET

Touchpoints
Touchpoints will be held on this zoom line at the following times (All ET) * Thursday, May 14th - 10:30a, 2:00p, 5:00p * Friday, May 15th - 9:00a, 2:00p, 5:00p

https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2020-05+FHIRcast+track
Hi, please let me know if there is a hub offering the SMART stand-alone launch - otherwise I would like to join a different track.
Hey @Bas van den Heuvel - does your Hub include a SMART server?

Yes - there is a angular application running at http://212.187.34.124:4401/ which talks to a FHIRcast server whose huburl is: http://212.187.34.124:9410/api/sync/fhircast
The current topic is FC-topic-1589449929600

Too bad - no SMART support yet
Thanks! I give it a try.
Sorry, I did not read the your last line. If someone has implemented the SMART stand-alone launch on their hub, please reach out. thanks.
@Martin Bellehumeur - during out touchbase right now, Niklas mentioned that Nuance has a Hub that support SMART and websockets.
I think he meant websocket and tokens. No SMART launch sequence but they have another way to get the current DiagnosticReport after launch.

Hey Guys, tomorrow at 9am EST on the FHIRcast zoom channel, we're going to discuss prioritizing websockets over rest-hooks and answer the question:

Do we really need rest-hooks in FHIRcast ? :exclamation:

(See FHIRcast track agenda).

Hey @Shilpy Sharma, here's @Bas van den Heuvel 's opensource Java/angular Hub and FHIRcast client implementation -- https://github.com/PhilipsOnFhir/fhir-cast. I think this could be a great place to start looking at supporting FHIRcast in Logica.
@Martin Bellehumeur - do you have anything publically available that people can test against?
Hey @Bas van den Heuvel - can I put a demo of your Hub+client on the agenda for the 2p touchbase?
Sure
Thanks @Isaac Vetter

Isaac Vetter said:

Hey Shilpy Sharma, here's Bas van den Heuvel 's opensource Java/angular Hub and FHIRcast client implementation -- https://github.com/PhilipsOnFhir/fhir-cast. I think this could be a great place to start looking at supporting FHIRcast in Logica.

Please note that this code still represents a older version of the spec - we plan to update it in the near future.

Isaac Vetter said:

Martin Bellehumeur - do you have anything publically available that people can test against?

Hi, I can't put it online. Please understand when imaging firms hear ‘connectathon’, they’re thinking “IHE”, conformance statements, etc. Maybe next time.
Perhaps I can discuss the three additional endpoints (discovery,auth,token) , share code snippets and discuss implementation challenges in the call.

Hey Guys - FHIRcast connectathon track report-out is here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1B6FvP5IP83tuUPvOMQjZIR5jYyw4OSbahgRqnbkPZZ8/edit#heading=h.gdwzrh3qtlwi

All suggestions/feedback/additions/deletions, welcome!
@Bas van den Heuvel @Isaac Vetter are we getting back on the zoom meeting. @Bas van den Heuvel I still need to get some more clarification on the setup.
@Shilpy Sharma - just re-opened the zoom. No Bas, yet.

@Bas van den Heuvel Thanks for sharing your code on github https://github.com/PhilipsOnFhir/fhir-playground-r4/tree/connecthaton24. Could you also please add a detailed README explaining how to run this project locally.
If I can find some time this week I will.
@Bas van den Heuvel Thanks
@Shilpy Sharma , I revised the code - can you check whether it compiles and runs?
@Bas van den Heuvel Thanks for revising the code. I haven't had the chance to check it yet. I will check it in few weeks and get in touch. Thanks again.
Great
